news.title: Google was at risk of losing its dominance — until it promoted this AI executive
news.description: Josh Woodward, a 16-year Google veteran, is tasked with running the Gemini app and going head-to-head with OpenAI in the booming generative AI market.

news.title: Epstein files released by DOJ
news.description: President Donald Trump signed the Epstein Files Transparency Act in November.

news.title: Abel takes over for Buffett in less than two weeks. Wall Street has some advice for new Berkshire CEO
news.description: With Warren Buffett's planned departure as Berkshire Hathaway's CEO less than two weeks away, some on Wall Street have advice for incoming CEO Greg Abel.

news.title: Roomba's bankruptcy may wreck a lot more than one robot vacuum maker
news.description: Roomba's bankruptcy should serve as a warning sign to many small companies that big tech may not be able to come to the rescue, say M&A experts.

news.title: S&P 500 coasts to a third year of superior returns. Three key questions for Wall Street entering 2026
news.description: While the swing factors are inherently unpredictable, there seem a few broad questions hovering over the market as 2025 slips into the past.

news.title: Bank of America says Nvidia and these stocks are its top picks for 2026
news.description: Bank of America named its favorite stocks to buy in 2026

news.title: Italy's Telecom Italia wins $1.2 billion court payout, eyes savings share conversion
news.description: The amount TIM is entitled to is roughly double the original licence fee, worth slightly more than 500 million euros, due to revaluation and accrued interest.

news.title: I stayed in a $40 capsule hotel as return to office mandates drive workers back to the city
news.description: RTO mandates has workers who don't live in cities scrambling to find inexpensive ways of staying in the city without resorting to hostels.

news.title: U.S. seizes vessel off Venezuelan coast: Reuters
news.description: The move comes just days after U.S. President Donald Trump announced a "blockade" of all sanctioned oil tankers entering and leaving Venezuela.

news.title: Check out the winning hedge fund strategies of 2025
news.description: As 2025 draws to a close, hedge funds' annual performances face close scrutiny among investors.

news.title: Former Trump advisor Dina Powell McCormick leaves Meta board after eight-month stint
news.description: Dina Powell McCormick, who was a member of President Donald Trump's first administration, has resigned from Meta's board of directors.

news.title: Musk's $56 billion Tesla pay package must be restored as court rules cancellation was too extreme
news.description: Shareholder Richard J. Tornetta brought the suit, accusing Musk and the Tesla board of a breach of fiduciary duties.

news.title: Nine of the largest pharma companies ink deals with Trump to lower drug prices
news.description: President Donald Trump has pushed to lower drug prices for Americans, which are on average nearly three times higher than overseas.

news.title: Wall Street heads into the new week with a year-end rally in doubt
news.description: December is a seasonally strong period for stocks. But an unusually weak stretch has investors wary.

news.title: Santa Claus rally: What is it and will it occur this year?
news.description: As the new year draws closer, eyes are turning to Wall Street to see whether it will pull off the coveted Santa Claus rally.

news.title: Trump's name added to Kennedy Center building a day after board votes to rename DC theater
news.description: President Kennedy's niece, Maria Shriver, said it is "beyond comprehension that this sitting president has sought to rename this great memorial."

news.title: Trust these numbers? Economists see a lot of flaws in delayed CPI report showing downward inflation
news.description: Thursday saw the release of a much lighter-than-expected inflation report for November, and economists are already questioning its significance.

news.title: November consumer prices rose at a 2.7% annual rate, lower than expected, delayed data shows
news.description: Economists polled by Dow Jones expected CPI to have risen 3.1% on an annualized basis.

news.title: Bank of England cuts interest rates, in welcome Christmas boost for consumers
news.description: The Bank of England voted to cut interest rates from 4% to 3.75% in its last monetary policy move of 2025.

news.title: November's inflation report is the first to be released after the shutdown. Here's what to expect
news.description: November's CPI report is expected to show the annual inflation rate at 3.1%, according to economists polled by Dow Jones.

news.title: Watch Fed Governor Christopher Waller speak on interest rates and the race to succeed Powell
news.description: Waller is one of the five finalists considered for to replace Fed Chairman Jerome Powell when his term expires in May.

news.title: Hassett says Fed independence is ‘really important’ and chair candidates shouldn’t be disqualified for being Trump’s friend
news.description: Hassett declined in a CNBC interview to directly address his own candidacy but said forging consensus is an important part of the job.

news.title: Lucid's big SUV arrives with high expectations, and big risks
news.description: Lucid Motors says its Gravity SUV will sell far better than its Air sedan. But Lucid is losing money, and the rollout has been challenging.

news.title: Cramer says Boeing is a buy here — plus, Wells Fargo and bank stocks keep rolling
news.description: The Investing Club holds its "Morning Meeting" every weekday at 10:20 a.m. ET.

news.title: U.S., Russian officials to meet in Florida for more Ukraine talks
news.description: U.S. negotiators are set to meet Russian officials in Florida on Saturday for the latest talks aimed at ending Russia's war in Ukraine.

news.title: U.S. hits ISIS in Syria with large retaliatory strikes, officials say
news.description: President Donald Trump had vowed to retaliate after a suspected ISIS attack killed U.S. personnel last weekend in Syria.

news.title: European Union approves over $105 billion toward Ukraine aid package for next two years
news.description: European Union countries have agreed to allocate 90 billion euros ($105.5 billion) in aid to Ukraine for 2026 and 2027, the EU Council President said on Friday.
